I bow my head before the sorrows of the brokenhearted  Edward — I tremble at the black brows of Moray — and thrill to the bone as I see Catherine trying to unloosen the visor of her seducer, dead on the battle-field, and hear her crying, " Christie of the Clinthill, Rowley, Hutcheon, ye were constant to him at the feast, but ye fled from him at the fray, false villains as ye are !
